text: The Rabnitzbach (also Rabnitz) is a river of Styria, Austria, one of the source rivers of the Rába. The Rabnitzbach originates near mount Schöckl and flows in south-east direction to Gleisdorf where it merges with the Rába. The river reaches a length of app. . The water has Grade A quality and is one cleaner waters of Styria. It is rich on fishes. The normally harmless river can very quickly become a flood hazard and has already been a threat several times. Dangerous points have been mitigated without causing significant damage to nature. ==References== Category:Rivers of Styria Category:Graz Highlands Category:Rivers of Austria
title: Rabnitzbach
